sentences.en: Bormann's intrigue had fallen through this time.
sentences.cn: 这回博尔曼的阴谋破产了.

sentences.en: By this time, I have fully wised up to their intrigue.
sentences.cn: 到这时, 我已经完全识破他们的阴谋诡计.

sentences.en: Fairy tales can intrigue most children.
sentences.cn: 神话故事能引起大多数孩子的兴趣.

sentences.en: He is too lofty to stoop to vulgar intrigue.
sentences.cn: 他的清高使他还不至于屈就卑俗的勾当.

sentences.en: It is said that he is a master of intrigue.
sentences.cn: 据说他是搞阴谋诡计的老手.

sentences.en: It’s an exciting story of political intrigue and murder.
sentences.cn: 那是一个关于政治阴谋和谋杀的故事，扣人心弦。

sentences.en: Muttering among themselves for hours, the men developed a deepening sense of intrigue and of brotherhood.
sentences.cn: 他们一连几个小时地这么低声交谈, 逐渐产生了一种患难与共、同舟共济的感情.

sentences.en: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.cn: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

sentences.en: She said that was a dreadful intrigue in which her son was engaged.
sentences.cn: 她说那是个可怕的圈套,她的儿子是上了当.

sentences.en: The city was known as a hotbed of intrigue.
sentences.cn: 这个城市被认为是个滋生阴谋诡计的温床.

sentences.en: The king's younger brother took part in the intrigue.
sentences.cn: 国王的弟弟参与了该阴谋.

sentences.en: The palace was a nest of intrigue.
sentences.cn: 这座宫殿曾是阴谋诡计的策源地.

sentences.en: The royal palace was filled with intrigue.
sentences.cn: 皇宫中充满了勾心斗角.

sentences.en: The shapes of clouds intrigue me.
sentences.cn: 云的形状激起我的兴趣.

sentences.en: They spiced their conversations and discussions with intrigue.
sentences.cn: 他们的谈话和讨论透着些许的神秘。

sentences.en: This intrigue has been going on for some time and will continue.
sentences.cn: 这种阴谋,不但过去和现在是存在着,而且将来也还会继续的.

sentences.en: This is a novel of intrigue.
sentences.cn: 这是一本有阴谋情节的小说.

words.tran_cn: [法] 密谋者，阴谋者；私通者
引起…的兴趣；策划阴谋；私通（intrigue的ing形式）

trans.tran_en: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

trans.tran_cn: 用诡计取得；激起的兴趣
trans.tran_en: if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious
to make secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power

trans.tran_cn: 以谋略达成，激起…的好奇心
